result.execSummary:
The defendant Byron X Hunter was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Byron X Hunter is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Byron X Hunter was found guilty of Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Repeater], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: If probation or extended supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and governmental entities for the balance due.  Collections may include income assignment.  This applies to all counts and financial obligations.

Obey all of the rules and regulations of supervising probation agent.  Pay supervision fees.
*   Pay all court costs including all applicable surcharges.
*   Defendant ordered to submit to a DNA sample & pay DNA surcharge and notice was given.
DOC shall promplty notify the Court of any new arrest or criminal charge made against the deft.

supervisions.notes:
Probation Revoked.
Costs are rolled into sentence.

Minutes:  15CM1509/16CM44/16CM943.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA James Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in custody w/Atty Angela Komp.  Victim rights compliance.  Sentencing arguments made.  

15CM1509 & 16CM44 - deft sentenced to 223 days KCJ on each file concurrent.  Credit for 223 days.  Costs rolled into sentence.

16CM943 - deft sentenced to 126 days KCJ on each count concurrent and concurrent to above files.  Credit for 126 days.  Costs of $352.00 to be paid w/in 30 days.  In default, 7 days work crew or 7 days KCJ consec.

Appeal rights.
SEHR moved from 5/18 to 5/22/17 @ 2:30pm due to court's unavailability.  Email sent to attys & conveyance
SEHR adj to 5/18/17 @ 1:30pm due to ongoing jury trial.  Attys notified via email.  Conveyance notified as well

Minutes:  15CM1509/16CM44.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Kraus appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Cases are resolved.  Victim rights compliance.  

15CM1509 - deft pleads guilty to count 2; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 1 is dismissed on State's motion.

16CM44 - deft pleads guilty to count 1; found guilty by the Court.  Admits to repeater.  Count 2 is dismissed on State's motion.

Sentencing arguments made.  Sentence w/held; placed on probation for two years on each file concurrent.  See conditions.  Appeal rights.  DNA ordered; notice given to deft.

Minutes:  15CM1509/16CM44.  Clerk/T. Lehman.  ADA Krejcarek appeared for the State.  Deft appeared in person w/Atty Lauren Breckenfelder.  Mutual request for an adjournment.  FPT adj to 2/25/16 @ 10am, JS 3/21/16 @ 9am
No disposition. Leave on for next scheduled court activity.
